dcterms:creator: Jun Han
Salvator Lombardo
Christopher Schroers
Stephan Mandt
dcterms:description: Stochastic moving MNIST (SM-MNIST) consists of sequences of frames of size 64 × 64 × 1, containing one MNIST digit moving and bouncing off edges of the frame (walls). The digits move with a constant velocity along a trajectory until they hit a wall at which point they bounce off with a random speed and direction.
dcterms:title: Stochastic Moving MNIST (SM-MNIST)

dcterms:creator: Yingzhen Li
Stephan Mandt
dcterms:description: Sprites dataset consists of animated cartoon characters whose clothing, hairstyle, skin color, and action can be fully controlled. It includes 6 variants in each of 4 attribute categories and 9 action categories, resulting in video sequences with T = 8 frames of size 64 × 64 × 3.
dcterms:title: Sprites

dcterms:creator: Niki Aifanti
Christos Papachristou
Anastasios Delopoulos
dcterms:description: The MUG Facial Expression Database consists of 86 subjects, with each video containing 50 to 160 frames of facial expressions. The dataset includes six facial expressions and is used for training and testing video sequences of length T = 10.
dcterms:title: MUG Facial Dataset

dcterms:creator: John S Garofolo
dcterms:description: The TIMIT dataset contains broadband 16k Hz of phonetically-balanced read speech, consisting of 6300 utterances from 630 speakers. The data is preprocessed into sub-sequences of 200ms and used for speech recognition tasks.
dcterms:title: TIMIT Speech Dataset
